intro: Borago arabica, commonly known as Egyptian hedge mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are often used in traditional medicine. Borago arabica is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a hardy and adaptable species. It has been used historically for its potential health benefits, though its medicinal properties remain under scientific investigation.
